ovdesc.p: MF.ORDER application handles order processing.The records in this application could be created directly by manual input or from the pre-order application MF.ORDER.BY.CUST. The nature of information that would be recorded in this application would be similar to MF.ORDER.BY.CUST.The difference being that MF.ORDER can only handle subscriptions / redemptions to a single fund.The bulk orders, switches and plans could be recorded only in the application MF.ORDER.BY.CUST.

Field to specify whether the order amount is inclusive or exclusive of all charges. This is valid only for cases where the order is in terms of amount (all subscriptions and few redemptions). If the FEE.INCLUSIVE is set to YES, the amount that the customer is willing to expend including all charges is the amount specified in ORDER.AMOUNT field. The order amount in that case would be adjusted for the charges and the unit calculation would be adjusted in such a way that the total settlement amount for the customer does not exceed the order amount. It must be noted that this calculation (fee calculation) would be based on current NAV prevailing in the system at this price. If the unit allocation has to be based on future NAV, then there could be some variation and the amount of settlement could be less than or more than the order amount specified.
This should be set to 'YES' if PAYMENT.MODE is not Account.

Multi-value field to determine the purchase transaction towards which the redemption would be allocated. Input allowed only for Debit TRANS.TYPE (redemptions).

In case of redemptions, the same would be allocated towards the credit transaction specified. If the number of units in the Credit Transaction is more than the redemption amount, then units would be redeemed only to the extent of the redemption amount and balance units would remain. If the credit transaction units are not sufficient to cover the redemption amount, then the redemptions would be allocated towards the remaining Credit transactions on FIFO basis. If there are no other credit transactions, the redemption would only be executed to the extent of units available.
If the order in which units are to be redeemed is not provided here, the redemptions would be allocated on a FIFO basis

Specifies the date on which the order would expire. If not input, this would be defaulted based on the order expiry days ( field ORD.EXP.DAYS) provided in MF.PARAMETER. The default days would be added to the ORDER.DATE (working days) and this field would be populated.
If the order is not executed prior to that date, the order would be moved to history as part of COB on the date subsequent to order expiry date.

Specifies whether the order is a Price or Market order. In case of Market orders, the order would be executed at prevailing NAV. In case of Price orders, the price cap would be specified and if the NAV at which the order is being executed is greater than (for subscriptions) or less than (for redemptions) this price, the order would not be executed.
Allowed values are 'PRICE' or 'MARKET'.
